page.title: 07Social Concerns
page.content: {Social Concerns A{Public Enquiry}was held into the scheme of the Gwalia Housing Association,of Swansea,to build an estate of houses on the site of the old{Glyncollen House. The{Ynysforgan Residents'}Association was successful in its appeal against the building of flats which would have overlooked many small bungalows in the area. The Welsh Office Inspector,Mr.Donald Lindsey said that the threatened fine copper beech specimens should be preserved at all costs.The nearby Motorway would also create noise in excess of the 68 decibel level. In June 1985 the area was made into a play area.A tree planting ceremony was attended by Glyncollen children and by Cllrs Moriarty and Adams.
